text: Kerch is a city in Crimea, Ukraine. It is in the Kerch Peninsula. About 149,566 people lived there in 2017. Kerch began as a colony in ancient Greece about 2,600 years ago. In 1790, the Turkish navy was defeated by the Russian navy during the Battle of Kerch Strait. In World War II, the Red Army and the Axis fought there during the Battle of the Kerch Peninsula. == References == ==Other websites== Category:Cities in Crimea Category:Port cities and towns of the Black Sea
title: Kerch
